lines.text: What did he do to make this house so evil, Mr. Fischer?
Drug addiction, alcoholism, sadism, beastiality, mutilation, murder, vampirism, necrophilia, cannibalism, not to mention a gamut of sexual goodies. Shall I go on?
How did it end?
If it had ended, we would not be here.

[speaking to Benjamin Fischer while temporarily possessed by Belasco]
Who the hell do you think you are, you bastard? You might have been hot stuff when you were fifteen, but now you're shit!
You... me... that girl... Lionel... all together... naked... drunk... clutching... sweating... biting...

[after listening to a recording of Belasco's voice]
What made the record player turn on?
Belasco claimed he was able to will people's attention to an object and then move among them unobserved.
I doubt that.
Do you? Our attention was on that a moment ago. How do you know he didn't just walk right by us?
I get the impressin that you know quite a bit about Belasco. Do you mind sharing it with us?
His first name was Emeric. He was born on March the 23rd, 1879. He was the illegitimate son of an American munitions maker.
What did he look like?
"His was a frightening visiage, like the face of a demon that had taken on some human aspect."
Are you quoting?
Yes, I am. That is his second wife. She commited suicide in this room in 1927.

Welcome to my house. I'm delighted you could come. I'm certain you will find your stay here most illuminating. Think of me as your unseen host, and believe that during your stay here I shall be with you in spirit. May you find the answer that you seek. It is here, I promise you. And now, auf Wiedersehen.
I was the only one to make it out of here alive and sane in 1953, and I will be the only one to make it out of here alive and sane this time.
It's hideous.
We're not even inside yet, Miss Tanner.
I don't have to be.
This house... It knows we're here.
I'm sure it's nothing.
Are you?
Well, this house certainly hasn't lived up to its reputation so far.
It hasn't taken our measure yet.
The Lord certainly does move in mysterious ways.
So does this house.
Controlled multiple hauntings - something absolutely unique in haunted houses. A surviving will so powerful that he can use that power to dominate all other surviving sources.
You mean Emeric Belasco?
There is nothing in this house that we CAN handle.
In essance, the house is a giant battery, the residual energy of which must inevitably be tapped by those who enter it.
If there's anything you'd care to tell us?
What's to tell? The house tried to kill me; it almost succeeded.

you do not fight this house! Look, Hell House doesn't mind a guest or two. What it doesn't like is people who attack it. Belasco doesn't like it; his people, they don't like it, and they will fight back and they will kill you. So, listen to me. You just leave that damn machine alone and you spend the rest of the week resting, doing nothing. When Sunday comes, you tell old Deutsch anything he wants to hear and bank the money. If you try anything else, you will be a dead man, with a dead wife at your side!
Isn't it just another so-called haunted house?

It's the Mount Everest of haunted houses. There were two attempts to investigate it. Both were disasters. Eight people died. Fischer was the only one who survived, and when he crawled out he was a mental wreck.
You're the one who should leave this house. You're the one who's being used, not me.
He's like a general with his army, never entering the battle but always controlling it.
You can't solve it. It can not be solved. You're gonna die!

[said repeatedly during séance]
Leave a sample in the jar, please.
